description.narrative: Improved impact of resources to fight HIV/AIDS (and other diseases) and improved knowledge and practice of HIV and STI preventive measures by general adult population, youth and vulnerable population sub-groups.

participating-org.narrative: GLOBAL FUND TO FIGHT AIDS, TUBERCULOSIS

provider-org.narrative: GLOBAL FUND TO FIGHT AIDS, TUBERCULOSIS

condition.narrative: UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: 1. Number of media resp. community leaders, government and NGO staff, teachers and peer educators from various groups, e.g. informal traders, in-school and out-of-school youth, and uniformed services trained in communication, peer education and prevention education. 2. Number of young people exposed to HIV/AIDS education (in and out of school settings). 3. Number of people with high risk behaviors (members of uniformed services, women in informal trade activities, internally displaced persons, transport operators) exposed to BCC programmes. 4. Number of sex workers and their clients exposed to outreach programmes. 5. Number of condom distributed to people. 6. Number of service deliverers trained in providing testing and counseling services as per the UNAIDS VCT protocol. 7. Number of people receiving HIV testing and counseling including provision of test results. 8. Number of patients receiving comprehensive STI case management. 9. Number of people receiving Ois prophylaxis and treatment. 10. Number of people with advanced HIV infection receiving ARV combination therapy. 11. Number of HIV positive pregnant women receiving a complete course of ARV prophylaxis to reduce the risk of MTCT. 12. Number of health facilities applying national guidelines on blood safety and universal precautions. 13. Number and % of health facilities screening transfused blood units for HIV according to national guidelines. 14. Number of sentinel surveillance sites operational.Number of HIV/AIDS Prevention Brochures and Booklets distributed

No Baseline Number of people receiving Ois prophylaxis and treatment. 10. N/A Number of people with advanced HIV infection receiving ARV combination therapy. 11. N/A Number and % of health facilities screening transfused blood units for HIV according to national guidelines. 14. 2 Number of sentinel surveillance sites operational.
